segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 15. Tikaṇḍakīvagga
segments.en: 15. At Tikaṇḍakī

segments.pli: 143. Sārandadasutta
segments.en: 143. At Sārandada

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya vesāliṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
segments.en: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Vesālī for alms.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena pañcamattānaṃ licchavisatānaṃ sārandade cetiye sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayamantarākathā udapādi:
segments.en: Now at that time around five hundred Licchavis were sitting together at the Sārandada shrine, and this discussion came up among them,

segments.pli: “pañcannaṃ ratanānaṃ pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: “The appearance of five treasures is rare in the world.

segments.pli: Katamesaṃ pañcannaṃ?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Hatthiratanassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ, assaratanassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ, maṇiratanassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ, itthiratanassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ, gahapatiratanassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: The elephant-treasure, the horse-treasure, the jewel-treasure, the woman-treasure, and the householder-treasure.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ pañcannaṃ ratanānaṃ pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: The appearance of these five treasures is rare in the world.”

segments.pli: Atha kho te licchavī magge purisaṃ ṭhapesuṃ:
segments.en: Then those Licchavis sent a man out on to the road, saying,

segments.pli: “yadā tvaṃ, ambho purisa, passeyyāsi bhagavantaṃ, atha amhākaṃ āroceyyāsī”ti.
segments.en: “Mister, please tell us when you see the Buddha.”

segments.pli: Addasā kho so puriso bhagavantaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ;
segments.en: That man saw the Buddha coming off in the distance.

segments.pli: disvāna yena te licchavī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te licchavī etadavoca:
segments.en: He went to the Licchavis and said,

segments.pli: “ayaṃ so, bhante, bhagavā gacchati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho;
segments.en: “Sirs, the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha is coming.

segments.pli: yassadāni kālaṃ maññathā”ti.
segments.en: Please go at your convenience.”

segments.pli: Atha kho te licchavī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho te licchavī bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then those Licchavis went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,

segments.pli: “Sādhu, bhante, yena sārandadaṃ cetiyaṃ tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṃ upādāyā”ti.
segments.en: “Please go to the Sārandada shrine, out of compassion.”

segments.pli: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
segments.en: The Buddha consented in silence.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena sārandadaṃ cetiyaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi. Nisajja kho bhagavā te licchavī etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the Buddha went up to the Sārandada shrine, where he sat on the seat spread out, and said to the Licchavis,

segments.pli: “kāya nuttha, licchavī, etarahi kathāya sannisinnā, kā ca pana vo antarākathā vippakatā”ti?
segments.en: “Licchavis, what were you sitting talking about just now? What conversation was unfinished?”

segments.pli: “Idha, bhante, amhākaṃ sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayamantarākathā udapādi:
segments.en: “Well, Master Gotama, this discussion came up among us while we were sitting together:

segments.pli: ‘pañcannaṃ ratanānaṃ pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: ‘The appearance of five treasures is rare in the world. …’”

segments.pli: Katamesaṃ pañcannaṃ?

Hatthiratanassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ, assaratanassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ, maṇiratanassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ, itthiratanassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ, gahapatiratanassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ.
Imesaṃ pañcannaṃ ratanānaṃ pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmin’”ti.
“Kāmādhimuttānaṃ vata bho licchavīnaṃ kāmaṃyeva ārabbha antarākathā udapādi.
segments.en: “You Licchavis are so fixated on sensual pleasures, that’s the only discussion that came up!

segments.pli: Pañcannaṃ, licchavī, ratanānaṃ pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: Licchavis, the appearance of five treasures is rare in the world.

segments.pli: Katamesaṃ pañcannaṃ?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ,
segments.en: The appearance of a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: tathāgatappaveditassa dhammavinayassa desetā puggalo dullabho lokasmiṃ,
segments.en: A person who explains the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One.

segments.pli: tathāgatappaveditassa dhammavinayassa desitassa viññātā puggalo dullabho lokasmiṃ,
segments.en: A person who understands the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One.

segments.pli: tathāgatappaveditassa dhammavinayassa desitassa viññātā dhammānudhammappaṭipanno puggalo dullabho lokasmiṃ,
segments.en: A person who practices in line with the teaching.

segments.pli: kataññū katavedī puggalo dullabho lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: A person who is grateful and thankful.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, licchavī, pañcannaṃ ratanānaṃ pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: The appearance of these five treasures is rare in the world.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.
